periodLength

public int periodLength(int ignoredConnections)
Builds the connection sequence and calls periodLength (ignoredConnections, connSequence)

Parameters:
ignoredConnections - Number of connections to be treated as warmup
Returns:
The edge's period length when ignoring the first ignoredConnections connections

periodLength

public int periodLength(int ignoredConnections,
                        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> connSequence)
This method returns the loop period of the edge when ignoring the first ignoredConnections encounters. The loop period is an integer t such that every connection repeats after t seconds. The algorithm is quadratic, using naive pattern searching. Maybe adapting an efficient pattern searching algorithm may generate a linear solution.

Parameters:
ignoredConnections - Number of connections to be treated as warmup
connSequence - The edge's connection sequence returned by buildSequence
Returns:
The edge's period length when ignoring the first ignoredConnections connections

buildSequence

public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> buildSequence()
Builds an array containing the sizes of all the up times and down times of the edge in chronological order

Returns:
the ArrayList containing the sequence
